usefulItems: cling film, tart tin (Ø 22 cm), rolling pin, pastry brush, refrigerator, oven
title: Pear Frangipane

ingredients.content: 120 g butter, diced then frozen for 30 minutes
180 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
3 pears (e.g. Conference or Comice) peeled, halved, cored (approx. 320 g)
1 lemon, thin peelings of skin only

preparations.content: Place butter, flour, sugar, salt, egg and water in mixing bowl then mix <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>. Tip out and bring together into a ball then wrap in cling film and refrigerate for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, cook pears.

Place water in mixing bowl and insert simmering basket. Weigh in pears then steam <b>15 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set pears aside to cool. Discard water then rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Roll out chilled pastry between two pieces of cling film or on a lightly floured work surface and use to line a loose bottomed, fluted tart tin (Ø 22 cm). Set aside in fridge while preparing filling.
Place lemon peel and 20 g sugar in mixing bowl then grind <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides and lid of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and remaining 100 g sugar then beat <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add almonds and flour then mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then mix again <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer to pastry case in tart tin.
Cut reserved pears 1 cm from the top, lengthways, then fan pear pieces out. Arrange cut side down in tart shell. Bake for 35-45 minutes (170°C) until risen and golden.
Glaze with apricot jam while still warm, then leave in tin for 15 minutes before removing. Serve warm or at room temperature – delicious with a dollop of crème fraîche.

hintsAndTricks: Grind your own almonds if desired. Place 120 g blanched almonds in mixing bowl before beginning recipe then grind <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside until needed.
The pears will be just cooked (a knife should just pierce them easily) – they will continue to cook in the oven.
To prepare the pears, cut them in half lengthways and, using a teaspoon, scoop out and discard the core from the centre.
Scatter 1 Tbsp toasted flaked almonds over the surface for garnish, if desired.
Tinned pear halves can also be used. Omit step 2 and continue with recipe.
